name: New Componentes - With Adjust from Rodrigo
description: Building Linguistic Labyrinths. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.schema.message import Data
from axiestudio.inputs import DropdownInput, FloatInput
from random import random, gauss, uniform
import numpy as np
import scipy.stats as stats

class Random(Component):
    display_name = "Random"
    description = "Generates random values using boolean, uniform, normal, or exponential distributions."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Random"

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            options=['Uniform', 'Normal', 'Exponential'],
            trace_as_metadata = True,
            required = True,
            placeholder = '',
            show = True,
            value = 'Normal',
            name = 'distribution_type',
            display_name = 'Distribution Type',
            advanced = False,
            dynamic = False,
            info = '',
            real_time_refresh = None,
            refresh_button = None,
            refresh_button_text = None,
            title_case = False,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="start",
            display_name="Start",
            info="Start value of uniform distribution",
            value=0.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="end",
            display_name="End",
            info="End value of uniform distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mean",
            display_name="Mean",
            info="Mean value of normal distribution",
            value=0.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="standard_deviation",
            display_name="Standard Deviation",
            info="Standard Deviation value of normal distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="scale",
            display_name="Scale",
            info="Scale value of exponential distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Float", name="float", method="float_response"),
    ]

    def float_response(self) -> float:
        assert hasattr(self, "distribution_type"), "Please reload the component before proceeding."
        if self.distribution_type == 'Uniform':
            response = float(uniform(self.start, self.end))
            self.status = str(response)
            return response
        elif self.distribution_type == 'Normal':
            p = stats.norm.cdf(gauss(self.mean, self.standard_deviation), self.mean, self.standard_deviation)
            response = float(p)
            self.status = str(response)
            return response
        elif self.distribution_type == 'Exponential':
            random_numbers = np.random.exponential(self.scale, 10)
            p = (random_numbers / max(random_numbers))[0]
            response = float(p)
            self.status = str(response)
            return response
code.name: code

standard_deviation.name: standard_deviation
standard_deviation.info: Standard Deviation value of normal distribution

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.schema.message import Data
from axiestudio.inputs import FloatInput, DataInput

class GreaterThan(Component):
    display_name = "Greater Than"
    description = "Checks if value is greater than limit."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Random"

    inputs = [
        FloatInput(
            name="float",
            display_name="Float",
            input_types=["float"],
            required=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="thresh",
            display_name="Threshold",
            input_types=["float"],
            required=True,
            value=0.5,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Binary", name="binary", method="binary_response"),
    ]

    def binary_response(self) -> bool:
        response = self.float > self.thresh
        self.status = str(response)
        return response
code.name: code

code.value:
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.inputs import DataInput, BoolInput


class Gatekeeper(Component):
    display_name = "Gatekeeper"
    description = "Returns either a full message or an empty message based on the given boolean input."
    name = "Gatekeeper"
    icon = "custom_components"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input Value", value=""),
        BoolInput(
            name="passthrough",
            display_name="Passthrough",
            input_types=["Bool"],
            value=True
        ),
        BoolInput(name="allow_stop", display_name="Allow Stop", info="If False, will return an empty string instead of stopping the flow."),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        if self.passthrough:
            data = Message(text=self.input_value)
            message = Message(text=self.input_value)
            self.status = message
            return message
        else:
            if not self.allow_stop:
                self.status = Message(text="")
                return self.status
            self.stop()
            return
code.name: code

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="User",
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value="User",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node
code.name: code

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return
code.name: code

json_mode.name: json_mode
json_mode.info: If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

openai_api_base.name: openai_api_base
openai_api_base.info: The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.

output_schema.name: output_schema
output_schema.info: The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.

seed.name: seed
seed.info: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.schema.message import Data
from axiestudio.inputs import DropdownInput, FloatInput
from random import random, gauss, uniform
import numpy as np
import scipy.stats as stats

class Random(Component):
    display_name = "Random"
    description = "Generates random values using boolean, uniform, normal, or exponential distributions."
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "Random"

    inputs = [
        DropdownInput(
            options=['Uniform', 'Normal', 'Exponential'],
            trace_as_metadata = True,
            required = True,
            placeholder = '',
            show = True,
            value = 'Normal',
            name = 'distribution_type',
            display_name = 'Distribution Type',
            advanced = False,
            dynamic = False,
            info = '',
            real_time_refresh = None,
            refresh_button = None,
            refresh_button_text = None,
            title_case = False,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="start",
            display_name="Start",
            info="Start value of uniform distribution",
            value=0.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="end",
            display_name="End",
            info="End value of uniform distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="mean",
            display_name="Mean",
            info="Mean value of normal distribution",
            value=0.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FloatInput(
            name="standard_deviation",
            display_name="Standard Deviation",
            info="Standard Deviation value of normal distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,

        FloatInput(
            name="scale",
            display_name="Scale",
            info="Scale value of exponential distribution",
            value=1.0,
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Float", name="float", method="float_response"),
    ]

    def float_response(self) -> float:
        assert hasattr(self, "distribution_type"), "Please reload the component before proceeding."
        if self.distribution_type == 'Uniform':
            response = float(uniform(self.start, self.end))
            self.status = str(response)
            return response
        elif self.distribution_type == 'Normal':
            p = stats.norm.cdf(gauss(self.mean, self.standard_deviation), self.mean, self.standard_deviation)
            response = float(p)
            self.status = str(response)

        elif self.distribution_type == 'Exponential':
            random_numbers = np.random.exponential(self.scale, 10)

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.inputs import DataInput, BoolInput


class Gatekeeper(Component):
    display_name = "Gatekeeper"
    description = "Returns either a full message or an empty message based on the given boolean input."
    name = "Gatekeeper"
    icon = "custom_components"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input Value", value=""),
        BoolInput(
            name="passthrough",
            display_name="Passthrough",
            input_types=["Bool"],
            value=True
        ),
        BoolInput(name="allow_stop", display_name="Allow Stop", info="If False, will return an empty string instead of stopping the flow."),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Message:
        if self.passthrough:
            data = Message(text=self.input_value)
            message = Message(text=self.input_value)
            self.status = message
            return message
        else:
            if not self.allow_stop:
                self.status = Message(text="")
                return self.status
            self.stop()
            return

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="User",
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value="User",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node
code.name: code

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=["Machine", "User"],
            value="Machine",
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name", display_name="Sender Name", info="Name of the sender.", value="AI", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id", display_name="Session ID", info="Session ID for the message.", advanced=True
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

code.value:
import operator
from functools import reduce

from langchain_openai import ChatOpenAI
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.base.models.openai_constants import OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.inputs import (
    BoolInput,
    DictInput,
    DropdownInput,
    FloatInput,
    IntInput,
    SecretStrInput,
    StrInput,
)


class OpenAIModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "OpenAI"
    description = "Generates text using OpenAI LLMs."
    icon = "OpenAI"
    name = "OpenAIModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DictInput(name="model_kwargs", display_name="Model Kwargs", advanced=True),
        BoolInput(
            name="json_mode",
            display_name="JSON Mode",
            advanced=True,
            info="If True, it will output JSON regardless of passing a schema.",
        ),
        DictInput(
            name="output_schema",
            is_list=True,
            display_name="Schema",
            advanced=True,
            info="The schema for the Output of the model. You must pass the word JSON in the prompt. If left blank, JSON mode will be disabled.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model_name",
            display_name="Model Name",
            advanced=False,
            options=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES,
            value=OPENAI_MODEL_NAMES[0],
        ),
        StrInput(
            name="openai_api_base",
            display_name="OpenAI API Base",
            advanced=True,
            info="The base URL of the OpenAI API. Defaults to https://api.openai.com/v1. You can change this to use other APIs like JinaChat, LocalAI and Prem.",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="api_key",
            display_name="OpenAI API Key",
            info="The OpenAI API Key to use for the OpenAI model.",
            advanced=False,
            value="OPENAI_API_KEY",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        IntInput(
            name="seed",
            display_name="Seed",
            info="The seed controls the reproducibility of the job.",
            advanced=True,
            value=1,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        # self.output_schema is a list of dictionaries
        # let's convert it to a dictionary
        output_schema_dict: dict[str, str] = reduce(operator.ior, self.output_schema or {}, {})
        openai_api_key = self.api_key
        temperature = self.temperature
        model_name: str = self.model_name
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        model_kwargs = self.model_kwargs or {}
        openai_api_base = self.openai_api_base or "https://api.openai.com/v1"
        json_mode = bool(output_schema_dict) or self.json_mode
        seed = self.seed

        if openai_api_key:
            api_key = SecretStr(openai_api_key)
        else:
            api_key = None
        output = ChatOpenAI(
            max_tokens=max_tokens or None,
            model_kwargs=model_kwargs,
            model=model_name,
            base_url=openai_api_base,
            api_key=api_key,
            temperature=temperature or 0.1,
            seed=seed,
        )
        if json_mode:
            if output_schema_dict:
                output = output.with_structured_output(schema=output_schema_dict, method="json_mode")  # type: ignore
            else:
                output = output.bind(response_format={"type": "json_object"})  # type: ignore

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, e: Exception):
        """
        Get a message from an OpenAI exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """

        try:
            from openai import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return
        if isinstance(e, BadRequestError):
            message = e.body.get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return
